HTMLElementEmbed.summary: The <embed> HTML element embeds external content at the specified point in the document. This content is provided by an external application or other source of interactive content such as a browser plug-in.

blockquote.para: Note: This topic documents only the element that is defined as part of the HTML Living Standard. It does not address earlier, non-standardized implementation of the element.

remarks.para: Keep in mind that most modern browsers have deprecated and removed support for browser plug-ins, so relying upon <embed> is generally not wise if you want your site to be operable on the average user's browser.

-Other elements that are used for embedding content of various types include audio, canvas, iframe, img, {{MathMLElement("math")}}, object, {{SVGElement("svg")}}, and video.
-Positioning and sizing the embedded content within its frame: object-position and object-fit
